decks.notes: This deck is built around a fast and aggressive strategy, aiming to win as quickly as possible. It focuses on dealing direct damage to the opponent's life total with a combination of low-cost, high-damage spells and efficient creatures. The deck includes powerful cards like Goblin Guide, Vexing Devil, and Eidolon of the Great Revel to apply constant pressure and force the opponent to constantly react. It also includes burn spells like Lava Spike, Lightning Bolt, and Boros Charm to deal additional damage and disrupt the opponent's plans. The deck is designed to be incredibly efficient and relentless in its pursuit of victory.

The deck focuses on combining artifacts with powerful enchantments and spells to quickly deal damage to the opponent. It utilizes cards like Ensoul Artifact and Cranial Plating to boost the power of artifacts like Memnite and Vault Skirge, while also taking advantage of burn spells like Galvanic Blast and Shrapnel Blast to finish off the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Thoughtseize for disruption and Tarmogoyf for additional threat. With a strong mana base and efficient creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive plays and relentless pressure.

The deck revolves around assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Mine, Power Plant, and Tower) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. Using cards like Expedition Map and Ancient Stirrings, the deck consistently searches for and plays these lands. Once the Tron is assembled, powerful threats like Karn Liberated, Wurmcoil Engine, and Emrakul, the Aeons Torn provide control and win conditions. The deck also includes versatile removal like Oblivion Stone and Pyroclasm to manage the board, along with artifact ramp and card draw to support the deck's strategy.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells and removal while utilizing powerful creatures like Snapcaster Mage, Vendilion Clique, Blade Splicer, Restoration Angel, and Elspeth, Knight-Errant to close out the game. The mana base allows for flexibility in casting spells of different colors. The inclusion of creature lands like Celestial Colonnade adds resilience to the deck. The key strategy is to disrupt the opponent's game plan, deal with threats efficiently, and establish a strong board presence to secure the win.

The main focus of this Modern Aggro deck is to quickly burn through the opponent?s life total with efficient and direct damage spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Rift Bolt. The deck utilizes aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Hellspark Elemental to apply consistent pressure, while cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel punish opponents for casting spells. By maintaining a fast pace and overwhelming the opponent with a flurry of spells and creatures, this Red Deck Wins archetype aims to win the game before the opponent can establish their own game plan.

The main idea of this deck is to control the game through countering opponent's spells and disrupting their strategy, while ramping up mana with cards like Sakura-Tribe Elder and Kodama's Reach. The ultimate goal is to resolve Scapeshift and sacrifice enough lands to fetch out multiple copies of Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and do massive amounts of damage to the opponent. The deck also includes some versatile cards like Cryptic Command for additional control options. The key strategy is to control the board until you can assemble your win condition with Scapeshift and Valakut.

The main concept of this deck is to assemble the Splinter Twin combo, which involves enchanting either Pestermite or Deceiver Exarch with Splinter Twin to create an infinite number of hasty token creatures. This combo allows the player to overwhelm their opponent with an army of tokens and win the game quickly. The deck also includes powerful spells like Cryptic Command and Lightning Bolt for disruption and removal, as well as strong creatures like Tarmogoyf and Snapcaster Mage for additional pressure and versatility.

This deck focuses on assembling the Splinter Twin combo with either Deceiver Exarch or Pestermite and Splinter Twin to create an infinite number of hasty tokens. The deck includes cards like Remand, Spell Snare, and Dispel to protect the combo and disrupt opponent's strategies, along with cards like Serum Visions and Snapcaster Mage for card advantage and consistency. Vendilion Clique and Spellskite provide additional utility and disruption, while Lightning Bolt and Electrolyze offer removal and reach. Overall, the key concept revolves around efficiently assembling and protecting the Twin combo to quickly close out games.

This deck revolves around using Birthing Pod to tutor up various creatures from the deck to create powerful combos and synergies. The deck includes a toolbox of creatures that can be searched for with Chord of Calling or Birthing Pod, providing answers to different situations. Key creatures like Melira, Sylvok Outcast and Kitchen Finks can be used to gain infinite life, while cards like Murderous Redcap and Viscera Seer can provide a win condition through damage. The deck aims to control the board and outvalue the opponent by consistently assembling powerful combos.

This Jeskai Aggro deck aims to quickly control the board and pressure opponents by efficiently using low-cost spells and creatures. It focuses on tempo plays to disrupt the opponent's plans while deploying threats like Geist of Saint Traft, Delver of Secrets, Snapcaster Mage, and Young Pyromancer. The deck includes a mix of burn spells, counterspells, and efficient creatures to maintain pressure and control the game tempo. It aims to close out games quickly by applying pressure and disrupting opponents' strategies.

Dealing with opponents' threats proactively while maintaining a strong board presence through aggressive creatures and removal spells. The deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies early on with hand disruption spells like Inquisition of Kozilek and Thoughtseize, while also putting pressure on them with efficient threats like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant. Cards like Lingering Souls provide a steady stream of blockers and attackers, while Liliana of the Veil helps control the board. The deck is designed to be fast and versatile, punishing opponents for not being able to keep up.

This Modern Merfolk deck focuses on playing aggressive creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. By utilizing cards like Aether Vial and Mutavault to cheat creatures onto the battlefield, the deck can easily establish a strong board presence. Cards like Spreading Seas disrupt the opponent's mana base, while Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident pump up all Merfolk creatures. The key strategy is to maintain pressure on the opponent and use the synergy between Merfolk creatures to secure a quick victory.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by countering opponent's spells and drawing cards while ramping up mana. The ultimate goal is to cast Scapeshift and sacrifice lands to search for Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle along with other Mountains to deal massive damage to the opponent. The deck also includes cards like Snapcaster Mage and Sakura-Tribe Elder to provide flexibility and ramp capabilities. The key strategy is to efficiently control the game until the player can assemble the combo to win in a single turn.

This Tezzerator deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of removal spells, artifacts, and planeswalkers. It utilizes cards like Tezzeret, Agent of Bolas and Liliana of the Veil to disrupt opponent's strategy while powering out threats like Batterskull and Wurmcoil Engine. The deck also features artifacts like Mox Opal and Dimir Signet for ramp, as well as utility cards like Pithing Needle and Relic of Progenitus to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The lands in the deck provide both mana fixing and utility, allowing the deck to function smoothly in various matchups.

This deck aims to utilize the combo of Splinter Twin with either Deceiver Exarch or Pestermite to create infinite token copies of the creature. The deck also includes disruption spells like Remand and Cryptic Command to stall the opponent and protect the combo. Alongside card advantage engines like Serum Visions and Snapcaster Mage, the deck aims to quickly assemble the combo pieces and win the game in a quick and efficient manner. It also includes removal spells like Lightning Bolt and Flame Slash to handle threats on the opponent's side of the battlefield.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Twin combo with Exarch and Pestermite to create an infinite loop of token creatures with Splinter Twin. The deck also includes disruption spells like Remand and Cryptic Command to protect the combo, along with versatile creatures and removal like Snapcaster Mage and Lightning Bolt. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Blood Moon and Spellskite can disrupt opponents' strategies and protect key combo pieces. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble the Twin combo while controlling the game with versatile spells and creatures.

The core strategy of this Modern Aggro - Affinity deck is to flood the board with low-cost artifacts like Memnite, Vault Skirge, and Signal Pest, then buff them with Cranial Plating and Steel Overseer to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also utilizes powerful synergies like Arcbound Ravager and Inkmoth Nexus to apply pressure and push for a swift victory. With Thoughtcast providing card draw and Galvanic Blast offering direct damage, this deck aims to maintain a fast and aggressive pace to outpace and outmaneuver the opponent.

The deck focuses on quickly flooding the battlefield with artifact creatures, then using cards like Cranial Plating and Ensoul Artifact to quickly boost their power. Ensoul Artifact and Steel Overseer are key cards that can make your creatures more threatening, while cards like Arcbound Ravager can be sacrificed to pump up other creatures. With the ability to quickly overwhelm opponents with a swarm of aggressive creatures, this deck aims to win before the opponent can stabilize and counterattack.

The deck focuses on dealing consistent damage to the opponent using low-cost burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Rift Bolt, along with creatures like Goblin Guide and Grim Lavamancer. It also includes cards like Flames of the Blood Hand and Skullcrack to prevent the opponent from gaining life, and Searing Blaze and Molten Rain to disrupt their mana base. By being aggressive and constantly applying pressure, the deck aims to quickly reduce the opponent's life total to zero before they can stabilize or gain too much life.

The main concept of this Modern Aggro - Red Deck Wins archetype is to deal fast and consistent damage to the opponent using a variety of burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Rift Bolt as well as aggressive creatures like Goblin Guide and Grim Lavamancer. The deck aims to pressure the opponent early on and close out the game quickly, utilizing cards like Boros Charm and Skullcrack for extra reach and protection. This strategy requires careful resource management and efficient use of burn spells to maximize damage output and secure the win.

The main focus of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with fast and direct damage, utilizing efficient burn spells and aggressive creatures to quickly reduce their life total to zero. By consistently dealing damage turn after turn and pressuring the opponent to respond to threats, the deck seeks to maintain its momentum and close out the game before the opponent can stabilize. The key strategy is to maximize the use of burn spells and fast creatures to apply constant pressure and force the opponent into a defensive position.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively deal damage to the opponent as quickly as possible, utilizing a combination of burn spells and fast creatures. By using efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Rift Bolt, as well as creatures like Goblin Guide and Vexing Devil, this deck aims to pressure the opponent early and often, with the goal of winning the game before the opponent can stabilize. Grim Lavamancer provides additional reach and control, while the mana base of fetch lands and shock lands ensures consistency and speed in deploying threats.

The deck focuses on using quick reanimation spells like Goryo's Vengeance and Through the Breach to cheat out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Griselbrand. The deck also includes discard spells like Thoughtseize and Inquisition of Kozilek to disrupt the opponent's plans. The goal is to quickly and efficiently bring out these massive threats to overwhelm the opponent and win the game in a single explosive turn. The deck relies on a mix of combo pieces and disruption to create a proactive game plan.

This deck focuses on generating mana and card advantage through artifacts to quickly bring out powerful creatures like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Elesh Norn, Grand Cenobite. Using cards like Thopter Foundry and Krark-Clan Ironworks, the deck aims to ramp up quickly and overwhelm the opponent with powerful threats. With the ability to recycle artifacts from the graveyard with cards like Open the Vaults, the deck can quickly rebuild its board presence and continue pressuring the opponent. This combo-oriented deck aims to win the game through a combination of fast mana generation and powerful creatures.

The main concept of this deck is to be aggressive and control the game by utilizing a combination of cheap removal spells, counterspells, and efficient creatures. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while dealing damage through direct burn spells and efficient creature attacks. It also uses card draw and deck manipulation to ensure consistent plays and maximize its resources. The deck's mana base is designed to support its aggressive strategy and allow for flexibility in casting spells of different colors.

This deck focuses on aggressive play with an emphasis on disrupting the opponent's game plan. By utilizing efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Snapcaster Mage, along with versatile spells like Lightning Bolt and Cryptic Command, the deck aims to apply pressure while maintaining control of the game. The inclusion of disruptive cards like Blood Moon and Vedalken Shackles further adds to the deck's strategy of disrupting the opponent's mana base and tempo. With a mix of aggression and disruption, this deck aims to control the pace of the game and overwhelm the opponent.

The main idea behind this deck is to control the game by stalling with counterspells and removal, while ramping up mana with cards like Sakura-Tribe Elder and Search for Tomorrow. The key win condition is to cast Scapeshift, sacrificing lands to fetch Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle and a bunch of mountains, then dealing lethal damage to the opponent with Valakut triggers. The deck also includes some card draw and recursion with Snapcaster Mage to ensure consistency. It focuses on setting up a big combo turn to quickly finish off the opponent.

This Golgari Aggro deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's hand and board while efficiently putting pressure on with powerful creatures like Tarmogoyf and Scavenging Ooze. The deck utilizes a combination of hand disruption, removal spells, and efficient threats to control the game and close out matches quickly. By combining disruption and aggression, the deck aims to outpace and outmaneuver opponents in the early to mid-game, overwhelming them with powerful creatures and forcing them to play on the back foot.

The deck focuses on using the Twin Exarch combo to create an infinite loop of hasty 1/4 creatures. It contains support cards like Pestermite and Deceiver Exarch to enable the combo, and utilizes counterspells like Remand, Cryptic Command, and Spell Snare for protection. Removal and card draw spells like Lightning Bolt, Vapor Snag, and Serum Visions help control the board and dig for combo pieces. The deck also includes utility cards like Vedalken Shackles and Electrolyze for additional flexibility and interaction with the opponent's threats.

This deck focuses on assembling the UrzaTron lands (Urza's Tower, Power Plant, and Mine) to generate a large amount of mana quickly. It utilizes control elements like Oblivion Stone and Karn Liberated to disrupt the opponent's game plan while searching for win conditions like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn and Ulamog, the Infinite Gyre. The deck also includes cards like Sylvan Scrying and Ancient Stirrings to help find the necessary pieces to establish board control and overwhelm the opponent with its powerful late-game threats.

The deck focuses on using efficient removal spells and counterspells to control the game while using powerful creatures like Lightning Angel, Vendilion Clique, Venser, and Snapcaster Mage to close out the game. The mana base is built around fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistency in casting spells of all colors. The goal is to disrupt the opponent's game plan, generate card advantage, and apply pressure with versatile threats to secure victory in a longer game.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game and gradually build advantage through a combination of removal spells, countermagic, and powerful creatures like Restoration Angel, Geist of Saint Traft, and Celestial Colonnade. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while being able to apply pressure with evasive threats and efficient card advantage engines like Snapcaster Mage. By efficiently managing resources and outvaluing opponents in the mid to late game, the deck can take control and secure victory.
